patthana21.52:0.2_0: (These should be expanded as in the previous discourse.)
patthana21.52:0.3_0: Next there are buds, stones, sticks, and swords.
patthana21.52:1.1_0: Nor do you take pleasure in the support of the relieving on the formless, the support that arises.
patthana21.52:10.1_0: Being committed to the practice of exertion, but doesn’t give rise to mind. There is a cause of attachment to rebirth.
patthana21.52:12.1_0: Being diligent, they don’t mix closely with the mind.
patthana21.52:14.1_0: Being attached to the mind, they don’t take pleasure in being fettered to the mind. Relying on the mind that gives rise to the thought.
patthana21.52:14.1_2: This is the section in brief.
patthana21.52:16.1_0: Taking those on the patterns of the mind, not for the sake of putting down.
patthana21.52:18.1_0: Not disturbing the phenomena of mind.
patthana21.52:2.1_0: Nor do you take pleasure in the support of the relieving on the formless, the support that arises.
patthana21.52:20.1_0: Taking the patterns of the mind, not for the sake of purification of mind; for the sake of putting away and the mental processes; for the sake of worldly gain, not a cause.
patthana21.52:22.1_0: Taking the patterns of the mind, not of the mind. There is a cause of disturbed by the mind. Noble One gives rise to the level of the mind.
patthana21.52:26.1_0: No first thing gives rise to confidence in those without it ...”
patthana21.52:27.1_0: There is no cause or condition for the exterior sense fields.
patthana21.52:29.1_0: There is no cause or condition for desire, affection, and infatuation.
patthana21.52:3.1_0: (This should be expanded as in the previous discourse.)
patthana21.52:30.1_0: ‘This is the cause, this is the reason why one year ...’
patthana21.52:31.1_0: One doesn’t take pleasure in an appropriate offer to the teaching, nor for the sake of non-staple food, because of gaining material possessions.
patthana21.52:4.1_0: Nor do you take pleasure in the support of the relieving on the formless, the support that arises.
patthana21.52:4.1_1: (This is the same as the previous discourse.)
patthana21.52:5.1_0: Not disturbing the mind of the thought, not for the sake of worldly gaining material possessions, not for the sake of worldly gain.
patthana21.52:6.1_0: Not understanding the teaching of the mind, he doesn’t give rise to confidence in those without it.
patthana21.52:8.1_0: There is no cause or condition for the Teacher, of revealing, is for the sake of non-acting.
